intro: Randia perakensis, commonly known as the Java randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a small, globose capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
